==Events==
*[[1358]] &ndash; [[Republic of Ragusa|Republic of Dubrovnik]] is founded
*[[1497]] &ndash; [[Cornwall|Cornish]] rebels [[Michael An Gof]] and [[Thomas Flamank]] are executed at [[Tyburn]], [[London]], [[England]].
*[[1556]] &ndash; The thirteen [[Stratford Martyrs]] are [[burned at the stake]] near [[London]] for their [[Protestant]] beliefs.
*[[1743]] &ndash; [[War of the Austrian Succession]]: [[Battle of Dettingen]]: On the battlefield in Bavaria, [[George II of Great Britain|George II]] personally leads troops into battle. The last time that a British monarch would command troops in the field.
*[[1759]] &ndash; General [[James Wolfe]] begins the siege of [[Quebec]].
*[[1760]] &ndash; [[Cherokee]] warriors defeat [[British Empire|British]] forces at the [[Battle of Echoee]] near present-day [[Otto, North Carolina]] during the [[Anglo-Cherokee War]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; British forces take [[Buenos Aires]] during the first [[British invasions of the Río de la Plata]].
*[[1844]] &ndash; [[Joseph Smith, Jr.]], founder of the [[Latter Day Saint movement]], and his brother [[Hyrum Smith]], are [[Death of Joseph Smith, Jr.|murdered by a mob]] at the [[Carthage, Illinois]] jail.
*[[1895]] &ndash; The inaugural run of the [[Baltimore and Ohio Railroad]]'s [[Royal Blue (train)|''Royal Blue'']] from [[Washington, D.C.]], to [[New York City|New York, New York]], the first U.S. passenger train to use [[Railway electrification system|electric locomotives]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; The first solo [[circumnavigation]] of the globe is completed by [[Joshua Slocum]] from Briar Island, [[Nova Scotia]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[A. E. J. Collins]] scores 628 runs [[not out]], the highest-ever recorded score in cricket.
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Russian battleship Potemkin|Battleship ''Potemkin'' uprising]]: sailors start a mutiny aboard the battleship ''Potemkin'', denouncing the crimes of autocracy, demanding liberty and an end to war.
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Prime Minister of Japan]] [[Tanaka Giichi]] leads a conference to discuss [[Empire of Japan|Japan]]'s plans for [[China]]; later, a document detailing these plans, the "[[Tanaka Memorial]]" is leaked, although it is now considered a forgery.
*[[1941]] &ndash; Romanian governmental forces, allies of Nazi Germany, launch [[Iaşi pogrom|one of the most violent pogrom]]s in Jewish history in the city of [[Iaşi]], ([[Romania]]), resulting in the murder of at least 13,266 Jews.
*  1941   &ndash; German troops capture the city of [[Białystok]] during [[Operation Barbarossa]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; In the [[Canadian Citizenship Act 1946|Canadian Citizenship Act]], the [[Parliament of Canada]] establishes the definition of Canadian citizenship.
*[[1950]] &ndash; The [[United States]] decides to send troops to fight in the [[Korean War]].
*[[1952]] &ndash; Guatemala passes [[Decree 900]], ordering the redistribution of uncultivated land. 
*[[1954]] &ndash; The world's [[Obninsk Nuclear Power Plant|first]] [[nuclear power station]] opens in [[Obninsk]], near [[Moscow]].
*  1954   &ndash; The [[1954 FIFA World Cup]] quarterfinal match between [[Hungary national football team|Hungary]] and [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]], highly anticipated to be exciting, instead [[Battle of Berne|turns violent]], with three players ejected and further fighting continuing after the game.
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Audrey]] makes landfall near the [[Texas]]-[[Louisiana]] border, killing over 400 people, mainly in and around [[Cameron, Louisiana]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; After only three years in business, rock promoter [[Bill Graham (promoter)|Bill Graham]] closes the [[Fillmore East]] in New York, New York, the "Church of Rock and Roll".
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[President of Uruguay]] [[Juan María Bordaberry]] dissolves Parliament and establishes a dictatorship.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S.]] president [[Richard Nixon]] visits the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Air France]] [[Operation Entebbe|Flight 139]] ([[Tel Aviv]]-[[Athens]]-[[Paris]]) is hijacked en route to Paris by the [[Palestine Liberation Organization|PLO]] and redirected to [[Entebbe]], [[Uganda]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[France]] grants independence to [[Djibouti]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Italy|Italian]] [[Aerolinee Itavia Flight 870]] mysteriously explodes in mid air while in route from [[Bologna]] to [[Palermo]], killing all 81 on board. Also known in Italy as the [[Ustica disaster]]
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[Central Committee of the Communist Party of China]] issues its "Resolution on Certain Questions in the History of Our Party Since the Founding of the People's Republic of China", laying the blame for the [[Cultural Revolution]] on [[Mao Zedong]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; ''[[Space Shuttle Columbia]]'' launched from the [[Kennedy Space Center]] on the final research and development flight mission, [[STS-4]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[U.S. Route 66]] is officially removed from the [[United States Highway System]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Gare de Lyon rail accident]] In [[Paris]] a train collides with a stationary train killing 56 people.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Slovenia]], after declaring independence two days before is invaded by [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslav]] troops, tanks, and aircraft starting the [[Ten-Day War]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Tony Blair]] resigns as British [[Prime Minister]], a position he had held since 1997.
*  2007   &ndash; The [[Brazilian Military Police]] invades the ''[[favela]]s'' of [[Complexo do Alemão]] in an episode which is remembered as the [[Complexo do Alemão massacre]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; In a [[Zimbabwean presidential election, 2008|highly scrutizined election]] [[President of Zimbabwe]] [[Robert Mugabe]] is re-elected in a landslide after his opponent [[Morgan Tsvangirai]] had withdrawn a week earlier, citing violence against [[Movement for Democratic Change – Tsvangirai|his party]]'s supporters.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[NASA]] launches the [[Interface Region Imaging Spectrograph]], a space probe to observe the [[Sun]].
